data.title: Pluggable upgrade modules
data.body:
![upgrades](http://i.imgur.com/rXdxP0H.gif)

This adds two new traits (`Plug` and `Pluggable`) that act as a per-actor upgrade source to completement the existing `GlobalUpgradable`.  An ActorInfo with `PlugInfo` receives special handling by PlaceBuildingOrderGenerator in order to activate the specified upgrades on the `Pluggable` actor.  It is assumed that the plug actor will immediately remove itself from the world after it is placed.

These traits are used to implement the TS power plant, component tower, and ion cannon upgrades.  In order to support this upgrade toggling has been added to `AttackBase`, `DetectCloaked`, `WithMuzzleFlash`, `WithTurret`, `WithIdleOverlay`, `SupportPower`.

This currently replicates the original TS upgrade behaviour, which does not support production limits (yes, you can indeed place two ion cannon nodes on the upgrade center in the original game).  I plan on adding support for this in the future by making the `Pluggable` actor hold a reference to the `Plug`, but our production limit code is full of bugs that stop this from working right now (you can see some of these issues by putting tanya in an APC in RA) so i've deferred that until the TechTree code gets its long-planned rework.

data.title: Spectator slots block people from joining the game
data.body:
In CNC95 I have recently come across a strange glitch.

When people go into the spectator slot some players cannot join until the spectators are kicked. This has been tested with other players as well just to confirm this bug.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/10285213-spectator-slots-block-people-from-joining-the-game?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Mono 2.10 build failure
data.body:
`OpenRA.Mods.Common/UtilityCommands/FixClassicTilesets.cs(73,61): error CS0219: The variable 'oldLength' is assigned but its value is never used`

This breaks our automated fedora packaging, which is forced to run on a disgustingly outdated version of mono.

data.title: IDisable interacts badly with upgradable traits (e.g. broken TS stealth generation)
data.body:
Toggling an actor's functionality (naradr -> radar bin) should not change whether or not it is receiving a proximity upgrade.
Perhaps this coupling should be pulled out and made configurable/intentional, if it is not already.
I could not find anything directly tying these logics together in a clear manner.

![cloakgen-oddity](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4861023/6912574/dbcc3cb6-d738-11e4-90b2-1de892b2600a.gif)

This gif also shows that a proximity upgrade (and possibly others) restart the current animation, but that issue is unrelated.

If I am wrong about anything here please let me know and close this as necessary.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/10254844-idisable-interacts-badly-with-upgradable-traits-e-g-broken-ts-stealth-generation?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Make buildings explicitly provide their names as prerequisites
data.body:
The `Building` trait no longer provides any custom prerequisites automatically in order to keep things consistent.
Naturally, the lint check no longer cares about buildings. Overall, this amounts to 2 bogus trait dependencies being removed.
Buildings that need to provide their name as prerequisite now have `ProvidesCustomPrerequisite` with it's default value, which is now the actor's name.
Next step is to use that last part for upgrades, so the lint check passes for #7597.

Closes #5287.

Commits will be squashed, of course.

data.title: Limit amount of EnemyWatcher announcements

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
The `EnemyWatcher` will now only announce newly discovered enemy units if 1) the player has not seen any other units of the same player in the tick before, or 2) the discovered unit has the `AnnounceIndividual` flag set.

Previously, it would announce all individual units that haven't been seen in the immediately preceding tick.

The effect of the change is that you only get announcements when a new player's army comes into view, not when new units of an already discovered army approach.

data.title: Split TS weapons.yaml and fix weapons and aircraft
data.body:
Split weapons.yaml into multiple category yamls.

Made weapons match their original TS equivalents as much as possible (further fine-tuning might still be needed in some cases) with regard to names, damage, verses values, projectile type, and trails.

Additionally, fixed/improved aircraft flight/attack behavior (Orca Bomber and Banshee in particular).

Requires #7776.
